titlestmt.titleproper: Finding aid to the Woman's Collage Theater records SSC.MS.00329
titlestmt.author: Madison White

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2018-10-26 15:38:09 -0400.

change.item: This record was migrated from InMagic DB Textworks to ArchivesSpace.

physdesc.extent: (2 boxes. Other materials in the collection: posters in flat file.)

did.abstract: The collection contains financial records, memorabilia, photographs, publicity materials, workshop tapes, correspondence, and meeting notes pertaining to plays the Woman's Collage Theater produced.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for use without restriction beyond the standard terms and conditions of Smith College Special Collections. Unprocessed collection, so may be difficult to use. Collection is stored offsite; researchers must give 48 hours advance notice.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The collection was donated in 1990 and 1991 by Barbara Annsdater. Accession numbers: 90S-45, 91S-3.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The Woman's Collage Theater was founded in 1976 at Grinnell College in Iowa and relocated to New York City the following year. It was made up of eight theater professionals committed to reaching a wide range of people with entertaining and thought-provoking plays. The original members ranged in age from 22 to 50 and were of "different backgrounds, lifestyles, and political persuasions." The group produced plays that reflected their committment to diversity. They performed throughout the U.S, offering discounted or free performances to low-income groups. WCT was flexible and adaptable in its approach, performing in any available open space, frequently without lights or sound systems.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Woman's Collage Theater records, Sophia Smith Collection, SSC-MS-00329, Smith College Special Collections, Northampton, Mass.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains financial records, memorabilia, photographs, publicity materials, workshop tapes, correspondence, and meeting notes pertaining to plays the group produced.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Materials in this collection may be governed by copyright. For reproductions of materials that are governed by fair use as defined under U. S. Copyright Law, no permission to cite or publish is required. Researchers are responsible for determining who may hold materials' copyrights and obtaining approval from them. Researchers do not need anything further from Smith College Special Collections to move forward with their use.
